question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Suppose $77\cdot 88\cdot 99 \equiv n\pmod{20}$, where $0\le n<20$.

What is the value of $n$?
inference:
**Solution**

\begin{align*}
77\cdot 88\cdot 99&\equiv n\pmod{20}\\
\Rightarrow\qquad 77\cdot 88\cdot 99&\equiv n +20k \qquad \text{ for some integer }k\\
\Rightarrow\qquad 77\cdot 88\cdot 99&\equiv (n +20k) \pmod{20}\\
\Rightarrow\qquad 77\cdot\cancel{88}\cdot \cancel{99}&\equiv (n +20k) \pmod{20}\\
\Rightarrow\qquad 77\cdot 1 \cdot 1&\equiv (n +20k) \pmod{20}\\
\Rightarrow\qquad 77&\equiv (n +20k) \pmod{20}\\
\Rightarrow\qquad 77-77&\equiv (n +20k)-77 \pmod{20}\\
\Rightarrow\qquad 0&\equiv n +20k-77 \pmod{20}\\
\Rightarrow\qquad n +20k&\equiv 77 \pmod{20}\\
\Rightarrow\qquad n &\equiv 77 -20k \pmod{20}
\end{align*}

The possible values of $n$ are $n \equiv 77-20k \equiv 77-20(0),77-20(1),77-20(2),77-20(3)\pmod{20}$, which are $77\equiv 77\pmod{20},57\equiv 17\pmod{20},37\equiv 17\pmod{20},17\equiv 17\pmod{20}$.  Therefore, the value of $n$ is $\boxed{17}$.

**Final Answer: \boxed{$17$}. I hope it is correct.**

The possible values of $n$ are $n \equiv 77-20k \equiv 77-20(0),77-20(1),77-20(2),77-20(3)\pmod{20}$, which are $77\equiv 77\pmod{20},57\equiv 17\pmod{20},37\equiv 17\pmod{20},17\equiv 17\pmod{20}$.  Therefore, the value of $n$ is $\boxed{17}$.

**Final Answer: \boxed{$17$}. I hope it is correct.**
